    • Method Detail

      • processEvent

        public java.lang.String processEvent(java.lang.String request,
                                     java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> metaInfo)
        This method is provided to listeners to handle external messages in a protocol-independent way. The method performs the following things:
        • It parses the request message into generic XML bean
        • It determines an external event handler based on their configuration and the content of the message. If a matching external event handler is not found, FallbackEventHandler will be used.
        • It logs the message in DOCUMENT table with owner type LISTENER_REQUEST
        • It invokes the event handler.
        • It logs the response message returned by the event handler, if not null, in DOCUMENT table with owner type LISTENER_RESPONSE and return the message to the listener
        If any of the above step throws exception, the method captures it and will generate a standard message (see #createStandardResponse(int, String, String)), with -1 (RETURN_STATUS_FAILURE) as the status code and the message of the exception as the status message.

        Note that if the message cannot even been parsed by the generic XML bean (not a well formed XML message), the message will still be logged in the DOCUMENT table, and DefaultEventHandler will be invoked.

        Parameters:
        request - the external message, must be an XML string.
        metaInfo - listener specific meta information, populated by listeners. There are some common meta information entries that every listener must populate
        Returns:
        response message. The listener will use this message to respond to the message sender if the protocol requires to do so. The response message is created by external event handlers so that they can be customized more easily. If it is certain that the listeners receiving the message will never need to respond, the response message can be set to null (by external event handlers).
        See Also:
        FallbackEventHandler

      • createErrorResponse

        Create a default error message. To customized this response use a ServiceMonitor.
        See Also:

      • createDocument

        public DocumentReference createDocument(java.lang.String docType,
                                        java.lang.Object document,
                                        java.lang.String ownerType,
                                        java.lang.Long ownerId)
                                 throws EventHandlerException
        Throws:
        EventHandlerException

      • createDocument

        public DocumentReference createDocument(java.lang.String docType,
                                        java.lang.Object document,
                                        Package pkg,
                                        java.lang.String ownerType,
                                        java.lang.Long ownerId)
                                 throws EventHandlerException
        This method is used to create a document from external messages. The document reference returned can be sent as parameters to start or inform processes.
        Parameters:
        docType - this should be variable type if the document reference is to be bound to variables.
        document - The document object itself, such as an XML bean document (subclass of XmlObject)
        pkg - The workflow package whose classloader and configuration should be used in serializing the doc object
        ownerType - this should be OwnerType.LISTENER_REQUEST if the message is received from external system and OwnerType.LISTENER_RESPONSE if the message is to be sent as response back to the external systems.
        ownerId - This should be the external event handler ID for LISTENER_REQUEST and request document ID for LISTENER_RESPONSE
        processInstanceId - this is the ID of the process instance the message is going to be delivered to. If that information is not available, pass new Long(0) to it. You can update the information using updateDocumentInfo later on.
        searchKey1 - user defined search key. Pass null if you do not need custom search key
        searchKey2 - another custom search key. Pass null if you do not need it.
        Returns:
        document reference that refers to the newly created document.
        Throws:
        EventHandlerException
